DOC.brief_summary: This study design determine use peripheral nerve stimulation conjunction pulse oximetry adjunct traditional monitoring PACU reduce frequency severity sedation relate apnea hypoxic event .
DOC.brief_title: Peripheral Nerve Stimulation Reduce Hypoxic Events
DOC.detailed_description: The primary effectiveness objective determine transcutaneous stimulation generate respiratory response capable reduce extent duration oxygen desaturations patient presume risk obstructive sleep apnea ( OSA ) receive form anesthesia sedation . The primary safety objective demonstration peripheral nerve stimulation safe use prevent reduce sedation relate hypoxemic event .
DOC.criteria: Inclusion Criteria Males females > 18 yr old Flemon 's Score > 15 Able provide write inform consent Having gynecological , colorectal , orthopedic surgery , urologic surgery Baseline oxygen saturation room air > 96 % Peripheral neuropathy involve upper extremity Procedures require direct admission ICU site postanesthesia care unit OR Diagnosed obstructive sleep apnea ( OSA ) / use continuous positive airway pressure ( CPAP ) biphasic positive airway pressure ( BiPAP ) PACU . Presence implantable electric device , include internal defibrillator , pacemaker , leave ventricular assist device ( LVAD ) Postprocedure temperature < 35.5 Celsius evidence vasoconstriction Presence metal hardware either arm either shoulder Patients lack access bare skin arm surgery . History atrial fibrillation History bundle branch block Females menarche menopause current negative pregnancy test surgical history prevent pregnancy .
